description: Complete seed data for GBA system with TOP 8 QUESTIONS ONLY - optimized questionnaires, new scoring (1-52), and workflow updates
changeLog: Risk Profile: Reduced from 15 to 8 questions, new scoring 1-52 points (was 8-35)
Suitability: Reduced from 32 to 8 questions, knowledge quiz aggregated
Workflow: NO KYC required, basic customer details only
Rebalancing: Marked as FUTURE_SCOPE with default configuration

superAdminSetup.description: Phase 0: One-time system configuration by Super Admin

riskScoreCategories.description: Very conservative investors with low risk tolerance
Balanced investors seeking income and growth
Moderate to high risk tolerance with long-term focus
High risk tolerance with long investment horizon
Very high risk tolerance, experienced investors only
riskScoreCategories.warningMessage: ⚠️ HIGH RISK: Suitable only for very experienced investors with 15+ year horizon

riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.note: TOP 8 QUESTIONS ONLY - Optimized from 15 to 8

riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.questionText: When do you expect to need the money you are investing?
What are your primary investment objectives? (Select all that apply, up to 3)
Do you have an emergency fund covering at least 6 months of living expenses?
How many years of experience do you have with investing in stocks or mutual funds?
What is the maximum loss you could tolerate in a 12-month period before you would want to exit your investments?

options.text: More than 20% (I can handle high volatility)

riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.questionText: If your portfolio declined 20% in value over a short period (3 months) due to market conditions, what would you most likely do?
riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.note: BEST BEHAVIORAL PREDICTOR - Weight 2.0, past behavior predicts future behavior

options.text: Sell everything immediately to avoid further losses
Sell some investments to reduce risk
Hold all investments and wait for recovery
Hold and invest more if I have available funds
Definitely buy more - downturns are opportunities

riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.questionText: If your portfolio lost value, how long are you willing to wait for it to recover?
riskProfileQuestionnaireSample.note: TIME-RISK ALIGNMENT - Weight 2.0, aligns patience with time horizon

options.text: 5+ years (I invest for the long term)

scoringMethodology.formula: Sum of (Points × Weight) for all questions

exampleCalculation.totalScore: 34.5 → Round to 35 → BALANCE (27-34) → Wait, 35 is AGGRESSIVE (35-43)
exampleCalculation.correction: Actually 34.5 rounds to 35, but falls in AGGRESSIVE range

scoringMethodology.note: Scoring changed from 8-35 to 1-52 to provide better granularity

suitabilityQuestionsSample.questionText: Please select your current age group:
suitabilityQuestionsSample.note: TOP 8 QUESTIONS ONLY - Optimized from 32 to 8

suitabilityQuestionsSample.questionText: What is your approximate annual gross income (before taxes)?
What is your approximate total net worth (excluding primary residence)?
Do you have an emergency fund covering at least 6 months of living expenses in liquid investments?
suitabilityQuestionsSample.note: CRITICAL MULTIPLIER - Can reduce capacity to 20% if no emergency fund

suitabilityQuestionsSample.questionText: How many years of experience do you have with investing in stocks, bonds, or mutual funds?
During the last major market downturn (e.g., COVID-19 crash in March 2020), what did you do with your equity investments?
suitabilityQuestionsSample.note: BEST PREDICTOR OF FUTURE BEHAVIOR - Past actions > stated intentions

options.text: I sold my investments at a loss to avoid further decline
I did not have any equity investments at that time
I held my investments and waited for recovery
I bought more equity investments during the downturn

suitabilityQuestionsSample.questionText: Please answer the following 7 questions to assess your investment knowledge:
suitabilityQuestionsSample.note: AGGREGATED QUIZ - 7 sub-questions, score 0-7 maps to knowledge level 1-4

subQuestions.text: Which statement about investment risk and return is TRUE?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Positive relationship between risk and potential return over long term

subQuestions.text: What is the primary benefit of diversification?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Reduces overall portfolio risk without necessarily reducing expected returns

subQuestions.text: How does inflation affect your investments?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Real return = Nominal return - Inflation rate

subQuestions.text: What does NAV (Net Asset Value) represent in a mutual fund?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Per-unit price of the fund's holdings

subQuestions.text: Over a 10-year horizon, which typically delivers higher returns?
What is the main advantage of SIP (Systematic Investment Plan)?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Rupee cost averaging - buys more units when prices are low

subQuestions.text: What is the LTCG (Long-Term Capital Gains) tax on equity mutual funds held >1 year?

suitabilityQuestionsSample.questionText: What is your primary investment objective for this goal?

dimension4.name: OBJECTIVE_ALIGNMENT
dimension4.formula: Direct mapping from objective risk level

suitabilityScoringMethodology.limitingFactor: Knowledge (Level 3) limits overall suitability despite high risk capacity
suitabilityScoringMethodology.note: Conservative approach: Weakest dimension determines final suitability

modelPortfoliosSample.rebalancingNote: ⚠️ FUTURE SCOPE (Phase 2): Rebalancing marked as default configuration only. Implementation planned for Phase 2.

rmWorkflow.description: Phase 1-7: RM creates customer, goal, runs assessments, recommends portfolio
rmWorkflow.workflowNote: ⚠️ NO KYC REQUIRED - RM collects only basic customer details. KYC is pre-completed or handled separately. Financial calculator inputs (existing investment, monthly SIP) are taken during calculator step, NOT during goal creation.

customerCreation.kycNote: ⚠️ WORKFLOW CHANGE: KYC is pre-verified or handled outside this workflow. RM only collects basic customer info.
customerCreation.kycDocumentsNote: Not collected in this workflow - assumed pre-verified

goalCreation.description: MBA from top university in India (IIM/ISB)

currentInvestments.note: Can be updated after financial calculator

goalCreation.inflationRationale: Education inflation is higher than general inflation (6%)

riskProfileAssessment.note: ⚠️ UPDATED TO TOP 8 QUESTIONS ONLY - New scoring 1-52 points (was 8-35)

responses.note: Priya is 37, but using updated age bracket
Adequate emergency fund enables higher risk capacity
KEY RISK METRIC - Moderate loss tolerance

responses.selectedOptionText: Hold all investments and wait for recovery
responses.note: BEST BEHAVIORAL PREDICTOR - Held during COVID crash, proven behavior
Reasonable recovery patience for 60% equity allocation

riskCategoryDetails.description: Moderate to high risk tolerance with long-term focus

behavioralAssessment.keyStrength: Held investments during COVID-19 crash (March 2020) - Proven behavioral resilience

result.rmNotes: Priya shows balanced risk profile (Score: 33/52) with 10+ year horizon. Past behavior during COVID crash confirms she can handle 60% equity allocation. Emergency fund (6-12 months) provides good risk capacity. Suitable for balanced growth portfolios with 60/40 equity/debt split.

suitabilityAssessment.note: ⚠️ UPDATED TO TOP 8 QUESTIONS ONLY - Optimized from 32 to 8 questions

responses.note: Adequate emergency fund - no reduction in risk capacity

responses.selectedText: I held my investments and waited for recovery
responses.note: CRITICAL: Held during COVID-19 crash (March 2020) - Proven behavioral strength

dimension1_RiskCapacity.note: Strong risk capacity - good income, net worth, and adequate emergency fund

dimension2_InvestmentKnowledge.note: Good knowledge - understands basics but missed inflation and tax questions

dimension3_InvestmentExperience.keyStrength: Held during COVID-19 crash - Proven resilience under stress

dimension4_ObjectiveAlignment.note: Consistent with 10-12 year time horizon and 60/40 allocation

finalSuitabilityDetermination.explanation: Despite high risk capacity (4), suitability is limited to MODERATE (3) by knowledge and experience levels. Conservative approach ensures client protection.

allowed: Diversified equity mutual funds (Large-cap, Multi-cap, Flexi-cap)
Debt funds (all categories - Ultra short to Dynamic)
notAllowed: Small-cap funds (high volatility for moderate suitability)
Structured products, AIFs, PMS (beyond moderate suitability)
suitableProducts.note: Product restrictions based on MODERATE suitability level

recommendedAssetAllocationRange.note: Allocation range aligns with MODERATE suitability and BALANCE risk profile

regulatoryCompliance.finra_Suitability: Reasonable-basis, customer-specific, and quantitative suitability verified
regulatoryCompliance.sebi_ClientProfiling: Risk profiling and suitability assessment completed as per SEBI guidelines

step1_CorpusCalculation.explanation: Due to 8% annual education inflation, ₹50 lakhs today will cost ₹1.08 Crores in 10 years

rmReview.concern: Required return of 15.25% is higher than typical balanced portfolio returns (10-12%)

details.newTimelineNote: Child takes education at 20 instead of 18

recalculationWith12Years.newTargetCorpusNote: ₹1.08 Cr with 2 more years of 8% inflation = ₹1.28 Cr
recalculationWith12Years.achievabilityNote: This return is achievable with Balance Portfolio (10.5-12.5% expected return range)

filter1_RiskCategoryMatch.criteria: Match risk profile category (BALANCE) with ±1 level tolerance

filter2_SuitabilityMatch.criteria: Portfolio suitability category must match or be lower than client suitability

rejectedPortfolios.reason: Requires AGGRESSIVE suitability, client is MODERATE

filter3_RequiredReturnMatch.criteria: Portfolio max expected return must meet or exceed required return

rejectedPortfolios.reason: Max return (11.0%) does not meet required return (12.25%)

matchReasons: Risk Category: BALANCE (exact match with risk profile)
Time Horizon: 12 years (suitable for 60% equity allocation)
Behavioral: Client held during past downturn (can handle volatility)

alternative.note: DOES NOT meet required return. Requires SIP increase to ₹28,000 or timeline extension to 14 years
alternative.adjustmentRequired: Increase SIP from ₹20,000 to ₹28,000 OR extend timeline by 2 more years

systemRecommendation.rationale: Balance Portfolio is the ONLY portfolio that meets all three criteria: Risk profile match, Suitability match, and Required return match. It aligns perfectly with client's profile and goal requirements.
systemRecommendation.rmActionRequired: Present Balance Portfolio to client with detailed fund allocation and risk disclosures

customerWorkflow.workflowNote: ⚠️ WORKFLOW CHANGE: Customer has READ-ONLY access to the portal. RM presents proposal and obtains approval ON CUSTOMER'S BEHALF. Customer can view proposal but does not have interactive approval capability in the system.

section4_RiskDisclosures: Past performance not indicative of future returns
Equity investments subject to market risks
No guaranteed returns or capital protection

orderExecution.description: Automated order execution after customer approval
orderExecution.implementationNote: ⚠️ FUTURE SCOPE / DUMMY DATA: Order execution is NOT implemented in Phase 1. The workflow stops BEFORE order execution. This section shows sample data structure for future implementation. In Phase 1, RM manually places orders outside the system.
